content: 4. ExperimentalThe19F and1H NMR spectra were recorded from solutions in CDCl 3on a Bruker AV300 spectrometer at 282.36 MHz and 300 MHz respec-tively,13C NMR spectra were recorded on a Bruker DRX-500 instrument(125.8 MHz). Chemical shifts are given in 汛 ppm from CCl 3F (19F) andTMS (1H,13C), J values in Hz; C 6F6(每162.9 ppm from CCl 3F), CHCl 3(7.24 ppm from TMS), CDCl 3(76.9 ppm from TMS) were used as in-ternal standards. IR spectra were taken on a Bruker Vector 22 IRspectrophotometer.The X-ray diffraction experiment for 4a*0.54(CCl 4),7*3C 6H6wascarried out on a Bruker KAPPA APEX II diffractometer with graphitemonochromated MoK汐 radiation at 296 and 200 K accordingly. Thestructures were solved by direct methods using the SHELXS-97 program[20]. Refinement was carried out using the full-matrix least-squarestechnique using SHELXL [20]. All non-hydrogen atoms were refinedanisotropically. Hydrogen atom positions were calculated geometricallyand refined using the riding model. Disordered CCl4with partially oc-cupied position 0.54 in 4aand disordered benzene molecules in 7wererefined with restrictions. Crystallographic data for the structures 4aand7have been deposited at the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centreas supplementary publication no. CCDC 1898791, 1898792. Copy ofthe data can be obtained, free of charge, on application to CCDC, 12Union Road, Cambridge CB21EZ, UK (fax: +44 122 3336033 or e mail:deposit@ccdc.cam.ac.uk; internet: www.ccdc.cam.ac.uk).

4.1. Reaction of pentafluorobenzonitrile with resorcinol and orcinol1 Solution of 0.22 g (2 mmol) of resorcinol and 0.77 g (4 mmol) ofpentafluorobenzonitrile in 50 mL of acetonitrile was added dropwisein period of 3 h with stirring into solution of triethylamine (2.40 g,24 mmol) in 50 mL of acetonitrile, cooled to 0 ∼C. The mixture wasstirred for 20 h at room temperature and the solvent was evapo-rated. Silica gel column chromatography (eluent CCl4/CHCl 33:1)gave 0.77 g (84%) of viscous material containing (NMR 19F,GC每MS) 85% and 9% of isomeric triphenyl ethers 1a,b, respectively,4% of pentafluorobenzonitrile and 2% of unidentified compounds.

2 Solution of 0.59 g (3.1 mmol) of pentafluorobenzonitrile in 2 ml wasadded dropwisely with stirring into solution of orcinol monohydrate(0.28 g, 2 mmol) and triethylamine (1.20 g, 12 mmol) in 10 mL ofacetonitrile at 25 ∼C. The mixture was stirred for 2 h and the solventwas evaporated. Silica gel column chromatography (eluent CCl4/CHCl 33:1) gave 0.56 g (77%) of viscous material containing (NMR19F, GC每MS) 95% and 4% of isomeric triphenyl ethers 2a,b.

4.2.1.5,6,16,17,26,28-Hexafluoro-2,8,14,20-tetraoxapentacyclo[19.3.1.13,7.19,13.115,19]octa-cosa-1(25),3(28),4,6,9(27),10,12,15(26),16,18,21,23-dodecaene-4,18-dicarbonitrile 3aand 5,6,17,18,26,28-hexafluoro-2,8,14,20-tetraoxapentacyclo[19.3.1.13,7.19,13.115,19]octacosa-1(25),3(28),4,6,9(27),10,12,15(26),16,18,21,23-dodecaene-4,16-dicarbonitrile 3b1 Solution of 0.22 g (2 mmol) of resorcinol and 0.77 g (?1.7 mmol)of triphenyl ethers 1a,b (with 4% admixture of penta-fluorobenzonitrile) in 50 mL of acetonitrile was added dropwisein period of 4 h with stirring into boiling solution of triethyla-mine (2.40 g, 24 mmol) in 50 mL of acetonitrile. The mixturewas stirred under reflux for 23 h and the solvent was evaporated.

Silica gel column chromatography (eluent CCl 4/CHCl 33:1) gave0.37 g of solid material containing (GC每MS, NMR 19F) 6% oftriphenyl ethers 1a, 84% and 5% of isomeric tetraoxacalixarenes3a,b, 2% of pentafluorobenzonitrile.

2Solution of 0.22 g (2 mmol) of resorcinol and 0.77 g (4 mmol) of pen-tafluorobenzonitrile in 50 mL of acetonitrile was added dropwise inperiod of 2 h with stirring into solution of triethylamine (2.40 g,24 mmol) in 50 mL of acetonitrile, cooled to 0 ∼C. The mixture wasstirred for 4 h at room temperature and 10 min under reflux then a so-lution of resorcinol (0.22 g, 2 mmol) in 50 mL of acetonitrile was addeddropwise with stirring for 2 h. The mixture was refluxed for 20 h and thesolvent was evaporated. Silica gel column chromatography (eluent CCl 4/CHCl 33:1) gave 0.60 g of solid material containing (GC每MS) 28% oftriphenyl ethers 1a(M+456) and 70% of isomeric tetraoxacalixarenes3a,b (65% and 5%, M+526), double-play crystallisation of which fromCCl4gave 0.33 g (31%) of pure tetraoxacalixarene 3a.

4.2.2. 5,6,16,17,22,23,24,25,26,28-Decafluoro-2,8,14,20-tetraoxapentacyclo [19.3.1.13,7.19,13.115,19]octacosa-1(25),3(28),4,6,9(27),10,12,15(26),16,18,21,23-dodecaene-4,18-dicarbonitrile 4aand5,6,10,11,12,17,18,26,27,28-decafluoro-2,8,14,20-tetraoxapentacyclo[19.3.1.13,7.19,13.115,19]octacosa-1(25),3(28),4,6,9(27),10,12,15(26),16,18,21,23-dodecaene-4,16-dicarbonitrile 4bV.N. Kovtonyuk, et al. Journal of Fluorine Chemistry 222每223 (2019) 59每6764Solution of 0.22 g (2 mmol) of resorcinol and 0.77 g (4 mmol) ofpentafluorobenzonitrile in 60 mL of acetonitrile was added dropwise inperiod of 7 h with stirring into solution of triethylamine (1.20 g,12 mmol) in 20 mL of acetonitrile, cooled to 0 ∼C. The mixture wasstirred for 1 h at room temperature and 1 h under reflux.

Tetrafluororesorcinol (0.20 g, 1.1 mmol) was added and the mixturewas refluxed for 9 h, then another portion of tetrafluororesorcinol(0.20 g, 1.1 mmol) was added and the mixture was refluxed for 27 h.

After evaporation of the solvent silica gel column chromatography(eluent CCl 4/CHCl 33:1) gave 0.70 g of viscous material containing(GC每MS, NMR19F) 93% and 4% of isomeric tetraoxacalixarenes 4a,band 2% of triphenyl ether 1a, double-play crystallisation of which fromCCl 4gave 0.50 g (42%) of pure tetraoxacalixarene 4a.

4.2.3. 5,6,16,17,26,28-hexafluoro-11,23-dimethyl-2,8,14,20-tetraoxapentacyclo [19.3.1.13,7.19,13.115,19]octacosa-1(25),3(28),4,6,9(27),10,12,15(26),16,18,21,23-dodecaene-4,18-dicarbonitrile 5aand5,6,17,18,26,28-hexafluoro-11,23-dimethyl-2,8,14,20-tetraoxapentacyclo[19.3.1.13,7.19,13.115,19]octacosa-1(25),3(28),4,6,9(27),10,12,15(26),16,18,21,23-dodecaene-4,16-dicarbonitrile 5bSolution of 0.50 g (3.5 mmol) of orcinol monohydrate and 1.67 g(3.55 mmol) of triphenyl ethers 2a,b (24:1) in 15 mL of acetonitrilewas added with stirring into boiling solution of triethylamine(2.00 g, 20 mmol) in 110 mL of acetonitrile. The mixture was stirredunder reflux for 30 h and the solvent was evaporated. Silica gelcolumn chromatography (eluent CCl 4/CHCl 33:1) gave 0.80 g (41%)of solid product containing (GC每MS, NMR19F) 98% of compound 5aand ≒1% compound 5b.

4.2.4. 5,6,16,17,22,23,24,25,26,28-decafluoro-11-methyl-2,8,14,20-tetraoxapentacyclo [19.3.1.13,7.19,13.115,19]octacosa-1(25),3(28),4,6,9(27),10,12,15(26),16,18,21,23-dodecaene-4,18-dicarbonitrile 6aand5,6,10,11,12,17,18,26,27,28-decafluoro-23-methyl-2,8,14,20-tetraoxap-entacyclo[19.3.1.13,7.19,13.115,19]octacosa-1(25),3(28),4,6,9(27),10,12,15(26),16,18,21, 23-dodecaene-4,16-dicarbonitrile 6bSolution of 0.28 g (2 mmol) of orcinol monohydrate and 0.77 g(4 mmol) of pentafluorobenzonitrile in 2 mL of acetonitrile wasadded with stirring into solution of triethylamine (2.40 g, 24 mmol)in 8 mL of acetonitrile. The mixture was stirred for 1.5 h at roomtemperature and 0.5 h at 70 ∼C. Tetrafluororesorcinol (0.36 g,2 mmol) was added and the mixture was refluxed for 7.5 h. Afterevaporation of the solvent silica gel column chromatography (eluentCCl 4/CHCl 33:1) gave 0.83 g of viscous material containing (GC每MS)37% of triphenyl ethers 2a, 11% and 51% of isomeric tetra-oxacalixarenes 6a,b. Crystallization of viscous material from pet-roleum ether (bp 40每70 ∼C) and then from CCl 4gave 0.39 g (32%) ofproduct containing (NMR19F) 93% of compound 6a, 5% compound6band 2% of triphenyl ethers 2a.

4.3. Synthesis of bicyclooxacalixarenes 7 and 84.3.1. 6,7,8,14,24,27,28,29,32,33,35,36-dodecafluoro-4,10,16,22,25,31-hexaoxaheptacyclo [11.11.7.13,23.15,9.111,15.117,21.126,30]hexatria-conta-1,3(33),5(36),6,8,11(35),12,14,17(34),18,20, 23,26(32),27,29-pentadecaene-2,12-dicarbonitrile 7V.N. Kovtonyuk, et al. Journal of Fluorine Chemistry 222每223 (2019) 59每6765Triethylamine (1.20 g, 12 mmol) was added to solution of tetra-fluororesorcinol (0.36 g, 2 mmol) and 0.82 g of mixture containing(GC每MS) 25% of triphenyl ether 1a and isomeric tetra-oxacalixarenes 4a,b (69% and 4%) in 20 mL of acetonitrile. Themixture was stirred under reflux for 40 h and the solvent was eva-porated. Silica gel column chromatography (eluent CCl 4/CHCl 33:1)gave 0.40 g of solid product containing (GC-MC) isomeric tetra-oxacalixarenes 4a,b (79% and 3%), 14% of bicyclooxacalixarene 7and 0.18 g of viscous material containing (GC每MS) isomeric tetra-oxacalixarenes 4a,b (73% and 3%), 23% of bicyclooxacalixarene 7.

Triethylamine (1.20 g, 12 mmol) was added to solution of orcinol(0.28 g, 2 mmol) and 0.90 g of mixture containing (GC每MS) 10% oftriphenyl ether 2aand isomeric tetraoxacalixarenes 5a,b (80% and9%) in 150 mL of acetonitrile. The mixture was stirred under refluxfor 27 h and the solvent was evaporated. The reaction mixture wastreated with 50 mL of 5% aqueous HCl and then with methylenechloride (3 ℅ 50 mL). The extract was dried over Na2SO4and eva-poration gave 1.12 g of a viscous material. Silica gel column chro-matography (eluent CCl 4/CHCl 33:1) gave 0.47 g of solid productcontaining (GC-MC) isomeric tetraoxacalixarenes 5a,b (M+554,68% and 3%) and 27% of bicyclooxacalixarene 8(M+638). Bytriple crystallization of product from mixture (4:1) of CHCl 3andpetroleum ether (bp 40每70 ∼C) 0.12 g of product containing (GC-MC)of isomeric tetraoxacalixarenes 5a,b (90% and 5%) and 4% of bi-cyclooxacalixarene 8was obtained. Additionally crystallization ofmother liquor (0.35 g) from mixture (3:1) of CH 2Cl2and petroleumether (bp 40每70 ∼C) gave 0.15 g of solid product containing (19FNMR) bicyclooxacalixarene 8and isomeric tetraoxacalixarenes 5ain 69:31 ratio.

4.4. Complexation of oxacalixarenes 5a, 8 and 7 with NiCl 2and AgNO 3salts1. NiCl 2*6H 2O (0.0024 g) and mixture of bicyclooxacalixarene 8with tetraoxacalixarene 5a(0.0064 g) was dissolved with heating in8 ml of methanol. The solution was kept at 20 ∼C for 2 days and thespectrum of ESI-MS (+) was recorded. Figure (Fig. 4a) and analysis ofthe spectrum are given in the Results and discussion part. In additionto the complex ions listed in the text, there are also [M8+ Na]+(m/z661) and [2 M 8+ Na]+(m/z 1299) ions in the spectrum.2. AgNO 3(0.0018 g) and mixture of bicyclooxacalixarene 8withtetraoxacalixarene 5a(0.0064 g) was dissolved with heating in 10 ml ofmethanol. The solution was kept at 20 ∼C for 2 days and the spectrum ofESI-MS (+) was recorded. Figure (Fig. 4b) and analysis of the spectrumare given in the Results and discussion part. In addition to the com-plex ions listed in the text, there are also [M8+ H + CH 3OH]+(m/z671) ion in the spectrum.

3. Bicyclooxacalixarene 7(0.0019 g) and 0.0011 NiCl 2*6H 2O wasdissolved with heating in 8 ml of methanol. The solution was kept at20 ∼C for 2 days and the spectrum of ESI-MS (+) was recorded. Inspectrum there is only ion [M 7+ Na]+(m/z 763).

Interactionof pentafluorobenzonitrile with resorcinol, orcinol and tetrafluororesorcinolVladimir N. Kovtonyuka,?, Yuri V. Gatilova,b, Georgi E. Salnikova, Evgeni V. AmosovaaN.N. Vorozhtsov Novosibirsk Institute of Organic Chemistry, Novosibirsk, 630090, RussiabNovosibirsk State University, Novosibirsk, 630090, RussiaARTICLE INFOKeywords:Polyfluorinated oxacalixarenesBicyclooxacalixarenesPentafluorobenzonitrileTetrafluororesorcinolResorcinolX-ray diffractionABSTRACTSuccessive interaction of pentafluorobenzonitrile with resorcinol, orcinol and tetrafluororesorcinol inEt3N?CH 3CN system gives fluorinated tetraoxacalix[4]arenes ABAB and ABAC type in a good yield. Furtherreaction of obtained products with new additional equivalent of tetrafluororesorcinol or orcinol leads to theformation of the fluorine-containing bicyclooxacalixarenes. The ESI-MS method shows the possibility offluorinated tetraoxacalixarenes and bicyclooxacalixarenes complexes formation with metal cations.
